acknowledgments.summary: Sergey Temnikov and Vladimir Dashchenko of the Kaspersky Lab Critical Infrastructure Defense Team reported this vulnerability directly to Siemens.

notes.text: This CSAF advisory was extracted from unstructured data and may contain inaccuracies. If you notice any errors, please reach out to the designated contact at CISA CSAF: central@cisa.dhs.gov

notes.text: ATTENTION: Remotely exploitable/low skill level to exploit.
notes.title: Risk evaluation

notes.text: Food and Agriculture, Chemical, Energy, Water and Wastewater Systems
notes.title: Critical infrastructure sectors

notes.text: NCCIC/ICS-CERT recommends that users take defensive measures to minimize the risk of exploitation of this vulnerability. Specifically, users should:
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: ICS-CERT reminds organizations to perform proper impact analysis and risk assessment prior to deploying defensive measures.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: ICS-CERT also provides a section for control systems security recommended practices on the ICS-CERT web page. Several recommended practices are available for reading and download, including Improving Industrial Control Systems Cybersecurity with Defense-in-Depth Strategies.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Additional mitigation guidance and recommended practices are publicly available in the ICS -CERT Technical Information Paper, ICS-TIP-12-146-01B--Targeted Cyber Intrusion Detection and Mitigation Strategies, that is available for download from the ICS-CERT web site.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Organizations observing any suspected malicious activity should follow their established internal procedures and report their findings to ICS-CERT for tracking and correlation against other incidents.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: No known public exploits specifically target this vulnerability.
notes.title: Exploitability

document.title: Siemens SIMATIC WinCC and SIMATIC WinCC Runtime Professional

product.name: V14: All versions prior to V14 SP1

branches.name: SIMATIC WinCC Runtime Professional / SIMATIC WinCC (TIA Portal) Professional

product.name: V13: All versions prior to V13 SP2

branches.name: SIMATIC WinCC Runtime Professional / SIMATIC WinCC (TIA Portal) Professional

product.name: V7.4: All versions prior to V7.4 SP1
V7.3: All versions prior to V7.3 Update 11

notes.text: An authenticated, remote attacker who is a member of the administrators group could crash services by sending specially crafted messages to the DCOM interface.CVE-2017-6867 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 4.9 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: Siemens has released updates for the following products and strongly encourages users to upgrade to the new versions as soon as possible:
For more information on this vulnerability and more detailed mitigation instructions, please see Siemens Security Advisory SSA-156872 at the following location:

As a general security measure Siemens strongly recommends protecting network access to SIMATIC WinCC, SIMATIC WinCC Runtime, and SIMATIC WinCC (TIA Portal) Professional stations with appropriate mechanisms. Siemens advises configuring the environment according to Siemens operational guidelines in order to run the devices in a protected IT environment.
